Text: In the context of film, the term "long shot" can refer to two different concepts: one related to framing and the other to the duration of the shot. In "Children of Men," the term is often used to describe the latter, which involves an extended, uninterrupted shot without any cuts, also known as a "long take" or "oner." "Children of Men" is particularly well-known for its use of long takes, which create a sense of immersion and realism for the audience. These extended shots often involve complex choreography, camera movement, and seamless coordination among the cast and crew. Some of the most memorable long takes in the film include the car ambush scene, the escape from the refugee camp, and the climactic battle sequence. The use of long takes in "Children of Men" serves several purposes: Immersion and realism: Long takes create a continuous flow of action, making the audience feel as though they are witnessing the events in real-time. This immersive quality enhances the film's emotional impact and helps to create a more authentic and believable dystopian world. Immersion and realism: Long takes create a continuous flow of action, making the audience feel as though they are witnessing the events in real-time. This immersive quality enhances the film's emotional impact and helps to create a more authentic and believable dystopian world. Heightened tension and suspense: The uninterrupted nature of long takes can increase the tension and suspense in a scene, as the audience is not given a break or a chance to catch their breath. Not only can it open up new job opportunities and allow for more efficient communication with people from different cultural backgrounds, but it has also been shown to have numerous cognitive benefits. According to a study published in the journal "Cognition," bilingual individuals have better control over their attention and are able to switch between tasks more easily than monolingual individuals. This is because their brains are constantly adapting to and processing two different languages, which strengthens their ability to process and filter information. In addition, bilingual individuals have been found to have higher levels of "executive function," which refers to a set of cognitive abilities that include planning, problem-solving, and decision-making. This is because the process of learning a second language requires the use of these skills, and as a result, bilingual individuals tend to have better developed executive function. Furthermore, speaking multiple languages has been linked to a delay in the onset of age-related cognitive decline. In a study conducted by researchers at the University of Edinburgh, it was found that bilingual individuals were more likely to remain cognitively sharp in old age compared to their monolingual counterparts. However, it is important to note that these cognitive benefits do not come automatically with the ability to speak multiple languages. Text: Processed by BentleyBerner2000 Summary: US Secretary of Education, Miguel Cardona, discusses the need to raise the bar in education by prioritizing academic excellence, improving learning conditions, and preparing students for global competitiveness. He emphasizes that this transformational journey must be grounded in substance, not sensationalism, and we must collectively fight complacency and the status quo to ensure our children receive the education they deserve. The first area that must be addressed is Academic Excellence, specifically in reading and mathematics, which includes following the science of literacy, providing financial literacy courses, ensuring high standards for instructional materials, and pursuing well-rounded education that includes the arts. It also means recognizing that standardized tests should serve as a flashlight on what works and what needs attention, rather than driving outcomes from the top down. Boldly improving learning conditions is also essential, focusing on proactive mental health support and safe and supportive learning environments for students, which can be achieved through the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act and support for Full-Service Community Schools. Quotes: "Without that leadership, we would be talking about a very different situation today. But we can’t rest there. We must do more. We need to Raise the Bar." "The journey is the destination." "Our children cannot afford another round of policies that are not grounded in what is best for kids." "Raising the Bar means districts taking a close look at instructional materials to ensure high standards so that an A in school actually means something." "We need the same spirit of unity and bipartisanship we had in the first two months of the pandemic, when we looked past red and blue, and tapped into our humanity, courage, and American spirit." Transcript: Thank you to everyone, here and on the livestream, for joining us today for an important conversation on what it will take to Raise the Bar in education – and Lead the World – in three key areas: academic excellence, boldly improving learning conditions, and preparing our students for a world of global competitiveness. Achieving those priorities is part of a broader journey we can take to transform our education system for the better. It’s a journey that was made possible by President Biden and Vice President Harris’s leadership to make education a top priority and deliver the American Rescue Plan – a historic $130 billion investment in supporting our schools -- helping them reopen swiftly and safely and invest in the academic recovery they urgently needed. Without that leadership, we would be talking about a very different situation today. But we can’t rest there. We must do more. We need to Raise the Bar. That means putting the era of fiscal neglect in education firmly in the rear-view mirror – mustering the collective will to act boldly and unapologetically to address student underperformance and the decades of underinvestment in education. The toughest part of the job, just as it is for so many at the Dept, is the time away from family. For me, to this day, the best title I have earned in my life is, “Papi”. So, to help make this better, I started a routine with my 16 year old daughter. We started 2 years ago with this thing called Saturday shenanigans. Today, I’m here to tell you that, in education, too, the journey is the destination. You won’t be hearing about any shiny new initiatives today. But you will hear me invite you to join me on a journey of transformation in education — a journey of raising the bar in education, together. I know education opens doors – because my wife Marissa and I are proof of it. Because I’ve seen firsthand the way it transforms lives – as a student, as a teacher, school principal, and as a parent. So when we

Text: Sure, I'd be happy to talk to you about ADHD! ADHD stands for Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder. It is a neurodevelopmental disorder that affects both children and adults. ADHD is characterized by symptoms of inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. People with ADHD often have difficulty paying attention to details, following instructions, and completing tasks. They may also have trouble sitting still, staying focused, and controlling their impulses. There are three subtypes of ADHD: Predominantly Inattentive Type: This subtype is characterized by symptoms of inattention, such as difficulty paying attention to details, forgetfulness, and easily getting distracted. Predominantly Inattentive Type: This subtype is characterized by symptoms of inattention, such as difficulty paying attention to details, forgetfulness, and easily getting distracted. Predominantly Hyperactive-Impulsive Type: This subtype is characterized by symptoms of hyperactivity and impulsivity, such as fidgeting, interrupting others, and speaking out of turn. Predominantly Hyperactive-Impulsive Type: This subtype is characterized by symptoms of hyperactivity and impulsivity, such as fidgeting, interrupting others, and speaking out of turn. Combined Type: This subtype is characterized by a combination of symptoms of both inattention and hyperactivity-impulsivity. Combined Type: This subtype is characterized by a combination of symptoms of both inattention and hyperactivity-impulsivity. While the exact cause of ADHD is not known, research suggests that it may be related to differences in brain structure and function, as well as genetic factors. There are several treatments for ADHD, including medication, behavioral therapy, and lifestyle changes. If you suspect that you or someone you know may have ADHD, it is important to consult with a qualified healthcare professional for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment.

Text: Thank you for the additional information. It's clear that the default mode network and the task networks are the two main types of circuits that are affected in ADHD. The default mode network is active when we're not doing anything, while the task networks make us goal-oriented. In a typical person, these two networks are anti-correlated, but in a person with ADHD, they are coordinated, which is what's abnormal. The dopamine system acts as a conductor that should keep these networks out of phase or anti-correlated, but in ADHD, the dopamine system is not functioning correctly. This raises two questions: is dopamine not at sufficiently high levels, or is dopamine conducting the networks incorrectly?

Text: ADHD, or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, is a neurodevelopmental disorder that affects the brain's executive functioning, which includes a set of cognitive processes that are necessary for goal-directed behavior, such as planning, organizing, initiating, sustaining, and regulating behavior. People with ADHD may experience impairments in attention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity, which can significantly impact their daily functioning. Research suggests that ADHD is associated with differences in the structure and function of certain brain regions, including the prefrontal cortex, basal ganglia, and cerebellum. These brain regions are involved in regulating attention, motor activity, and impulse control, and abnormalities in these regions may contribute to the symptoms of ADHD. One of the primary neurotransmitters involved in ADHD is dopamine, which is a chemical that transmits signals in the brain related to motivation, reward, and attention. People with ADHD may have lower levels of dopamine in certain parts of the brain, which can lead to difficulties in regulating attention and motivation. In addition to dopamine, other neurotransmitters, such as norepinephrine and serotonin, may also play a role in ADHD. Imbalances in these neurotransmitters can affect mood, arousal, and attention, and may contribute to the symptoms of ADHD. Overall, the research suggests that ADHD is a complex neurodevelopmental disorder that involves differences in brain structure and function, as well as disruptions in the neurotransmitter systems that regulate attention, motivation, and impulse control. Understanding these underlying mechanisms can help to inform the development of effective treatments for ADHD.
Label: IA

Text: Sure, I can provide some insight based on the current understanding of how the brain functions in individuals with ADHD. In individuals with ADHD, there is often a communication problem between the default mode network (DMN) and the task-positive network (TPN), which can result in difficulties with executive functions such as working memory, attention, and self-regulation. The DMN is a network of brain regions that is active when an individual is not focused on an external task and is instead engaged in self-generated thoughts, daydreaming, or mind-wandering. The TPN, on the other hand, is a network of brain regions that is active during the performance of cognitive tasks and is responsible for goal-directed attention and behavior. In the scenario you described, the person's DMN and TPN were likely not synchronized, which could have contributed to their difficulty in completing the task of reading the paragraph. Specifically, the DMN may have been overly active, causing the person to become distracted by self-generated thoughts and mind-wandering. This could have resulted in the emergence of random ideas that were somehow related to the elements present in the text but not to the actual implications and ideas of the paragraph. At the same time, the TPN may not have been active enough, which could have resulted in the person's inability to focus on the straightforward aspect of the task and to extract the information and ideas conveyed in the paragraph. This could be due to a deficit in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC), which is a key region of the TPN that is involved in working memory, attention, and cognitive control. In summary, the person's difficulty in reading the paragraph could be attributed to a communication problem between the DMN and TPN, resulting in an overactive DMN and an underactive TPN. This, in turn, may have been due to a deficit in the DLPFC, which is a key region of the TPN that is involved in working memory, attention, and cognitive control. Based on these symptoms, the person may be diagnosed with ADHD, although it is important to note that a thorough clinical evaluation would be necessary to make an accurate diagnosis.

Let's start with our first topic: fractions. Lesson 1: Introduction to Fractions A fraction is a way to represent a part of a whole. It is written with two numbers separated by a line. The top number is called the numerator, and the bottom number is called the denominator. For example, let's say there are 8 dog treats, and your dog eats 3 of them. We can represent this using a fraction: 3/8. Here, the numerator (3) represents the number of dog treats eaten, and the denominator (8) represents the total number of dog treats. Now, let's take a quick quiz to test your understanding: Quiz 1: If there are 10 dogs in a dog park and 4 of them are playing fetch, what fraction of the dogs are playing fetch? A simplified fraction represents the same part of a whole but with smaller numbers. For example, let's say you have a fraction 6/12. Both the numerator (6) and the denominator (12) can be divided by 6. If we do that, we get a simplified fraction: 1/2. Now let's try another quiz to test your understanding: Quiz 2: What is the simplified form of the fraction 8/16? A) 1/2 B) 2/4 C) 4/8 D) 1/4 Please type the letter corresponding to the answer you think is correct.

Text: As one of the top contributors to the open-source community, PingCAP has made great strides with its popular project TiDB. This distributed hybrid transactional and analytical processing (HTAP) database has been embraced by developers around the world for its ability to support both OLTP and OLAP workloads, and its compatibility with the MySQL protocol. Since its creation in 2015, TiDB has gained a dedicated following, with over 38,416 contributors and more than 35,782 stars on GitHub. The project has also seen a steady stream of new forks, currently standing at over 6596. But it's not just about the numbers – the TiDB community is constantly pushing the project forward, with regular updates and improvements. The last update was just a few hours ago, on December 9th 2022, showing the active development and commitment to the project. Whether you're a seasoned developer or new to the world of open-source, the TiDB community welcomes contributions of all kinds. Join us on GitHub and help shape the future of this powerful database.

Text: Episode 1: "Unexpected Encounter" Jeniffer is a successful businesswoman who owns a building where Mick works as a temporary janitor. They cross paths but don't exchange words. Episode 2: "A Night to Remember" Jeniffer and Mick both have a terrible night at a club. They bump into each other and commiserate about their misfortunes, leading to a connection. Episode 3: "Chance Encounter" Jeniffer and Mick find themselves in a situation where they are forced to spend time together. They open up to each other and discover they have much in common. Episode 4: "Realization of Love" Jeniffer and Mick admit their feelings for each other, and they begin a romantic relationship. Episode 5: "Sabotage" Jeniffer's ex-boyfriend, Trump, attempts to sabotage their relationship by spreading rumors and lies about Mick. Episode 6: "Breakup Crisis" Jeniffer confronts Mick about Trump's claims, and they have a heated argument that leads to a breakup. Episode 7: "Misunderstanding" Jeniffer and Mick come to a realization that they were misled by Trump's manipulations, and they apologize to each other. Episode 8: "Deeper in Love" Jeniffer and Mick rekindle their relationship and deepen their love for each other. They make many happy memories together. Episode 9: "Tragic Event" Trump, who is jealous of their happiness, hurts Mick in a fit of rage, leaving him with severe injuries and amnesia. Episode 10: "Desperate Search" Jeniffer spends a year searching for Mick but ultimately gives up hope of finding him. Episode 11: "Unexpected Encounter II" Mick regains his physical health but not his memory. He instinctively goes to the club where he met Jeniffer, and they reunite while dancing. Episode 12: "Happily Ever After" After their reunion, Mick regains his memory, and they live happily ever after, grateful for a second chance at love.
Label: IA

Text: Jeniffer was a successful entrepreneur in her late twenties. She had built her business empire from scratch and was now the owner of several commercial properties around the city. One of her buildings was a high-rise office complex that housed several businesses, and she took pride in maintaining it well. Mick, on the other hand, was a struggling artist in his mid-twenties who worked temporary jobs to make ends meet. One day, he landed a temporary janitorial job at Jeniffer's building, and he was excited to have the opportunity to work in such a well-known location. Jeniffer was usually a busy person who didn't have much time for small talk, but she always made sure to greet her employees politely. One day, she was walking down the hall when she noticed Mick pushing a cart full of cleaning supplies. She nodded at him, but he didn't seem to notice her. She shrugged it off and continued on her way. The next day, Jeniffer saw Mick again, and this time she decided to introduce herself properly. She walked up to him and said, "Hi, I'm Jeniffer, the owner of this building. I wanted to introduce myself and thank you for doing such a great job." Mick was taken aback by her sudden introduction, but he smiled and said, "Nice to meet you, Jeniffer. I'm just doing my job." They exchanged a few pleasantries, and then Jeniffer went on her way. Mick couldn't help but notice how poised and confident she was, and he felt a little intimidated by her success. As the days went by, Jeniffer and Mick would cross paths frequently, but they never had a chance to talk for more than a minute or two. Mick continued to do his job diligently, and Jeniffer continued to run her business efficiently. One day, as Mick was sweeping the floor, he heard a commotion coming from one of the offices. He peeked inside and saw a group of employees arguing over a project. Jeniffer was standing in the middle, trying to mediate the situation. Mick couldn't help but be impressed by her leadership skills. She was calm, collected, and seemed to know exactly what to say to calm everyone down. He watched from a distance, admiring her from afar. From that day on, Mick found himself paying more attention to Jeniffer whenever she was around. He would steal glances at her when he thought she wasn't looking, and he found himself feeling drawn to her. Jeniffer, on the other hand, was oblivious to Mick's growing fascination with her. She had too much on her plate to worry about the janitor's crush on her, and besides, she didn't have time for a relationship. Days turned into weeks, and weeks turned into months. Jeniffer and Mick continued to cross paths, but their interactions remained brief and professional. It wasn't until much later that they would realize how much their lives would change because of their unexpected encounter. Little did they know that their chance meeting would be the beginning of a love story that would take them on a rollercoaster ride of emotions, heartbreaks, and ultimately, true love.
Label: IA

Text: It was a Friday night, and Jeniffer had just closed a deal that had been in the works for months. She was feeling elated and wanted to celebrate. She called a few of her friends and they agreed to meet at a popular club downtown. Mick had also had a long week. He had just finished a grueling shift at work and was feeling drained. He decided to stop by the same club to unwind. As the night progressed, Jeniffer found herself getting more and more annoyed. The music was too loud, the drinks were too expensive, and the crowd was rowdy. She was about to call it a night and head home when she accidentally spilled her drink on her dress. Mick had been standing nearby, nursing a beer, when he saw Jeniffer spill her drink. He couldn't help but chuckle to himself. Jeniffer looked up and caught his eye, and he quickly looked away, embarrassed. But then, as fate would have it, Mick accidentally spilled his own drink on his shirt, and they both shared a laugh at the coincidence. "Looks like we're both having a terrible night," Jeniffer said with a smile. Mick nodded in agreement. "I know, right? I feel like I should just go home." Jeniffer hesitated for a moment before saying, "Hey, why don't we get out of here and grab a drink somewhere else? This place is a bit too much for me." Mick was surprised but grateful for the invitation. They left the club and walked a few blocks to a quieter bar. They found a table in the corner and ordered a couple of drinks. As they talked, Jeniffer and Mick discovered that they had more in common than they thought. They both had a passion for art, and they both loved to travel. They commiserated about their jobs and the stresses that came with them. For the first time in a long time, Jeniffer felt like she could be herself around someone. She didn't have to put on a façade or pretend to be someone she wasn't. She felt a connection with Mick that she couldn't quite explain. Mick, too, felt like he had found someone he could relate to. Jeniffer was successful and confident, but she was also kind and down-to-earth. He admired her for her accomplishments, but he also appreciated her humility. As the night wore on, Jeniffer and Mick continued to talk and laugh, forgetting about their earlier misfortunes. They realized that they had been at the bar for hours and that it was getting late. "I should probably get going," Jeniffer said, reluctantly. Mick nodded. "Yeah, me too." As they stood up to leave, Jeniffer reached out and gave Mick a hug. "Thanks for tonight," she said, sincerely. "I had a great time." Mick smiled, feeling a warmth in his heart that he hadn't felt in a long time. "Me too," he said. "Let's do it again sometime." Jeniffer agreed, and they exchanged phone numbers before going their separate ways. As Jeniffer walked back to her apartment, she couldn't shake the feeling that something had shifted inside of her. She felt like she had found a new friend, but she also couldn't ignore the flutter in her chest when she thought about Mick. Little did she know that their chance encounter would be the start of a love story that would take them on a journey they would never forget.
Label: IA

Text: Jeniffer and Mick's relationship had been going strong for several months. They were deeply in love, and they couldn't imagine their lives without each other. Text: In this example, Row Level Security is enabled for the users table by using the WITH (security_barrier) clause in the CREATE TABLE statement. The user_policy policy is then used to specify the access control rules for the table. The TO authenticated, anon clause specifies that the policy applies to both authenticated users and anonymous users. The USING (TRUE) clause specifies that the policy always evaluates to TRUE and therefore it applies to all rows in the table. Note that this is just an example and you may want to customize the policy based on your specific requirements.
Label: IA

Text: Health-conscious and environmentally aware youth segment: This customer segment is primarily composed of young people aged 15-25 who prioritize a healthy lifestyle and are conscious about the environmental impact of the products they consume. They tend to be well-informed about nutrition, have active lifestyles, and look for products that are sustainably sourced. Product preferences: They prefer all-natural, organic, and non-GMO ingredients in their salsa. Low-sodium, low-sugar, and no artificial preservatives or additives are crucial. This segment also values eco-friendly packaging and transparent labeling that showcases the product's sustainable and ethical sourcing. Interests: These individuals are interested in fitness, outdoor activities, and maintaining a balanced diet. They are likely to engage with content related to wellness, nutrition, and environmental conservation on social media platforms. Snacking consumption habits: This segment tends to choose snacks that are nutrient-dense and minimally processed. They look for portion-controlled options and often pair their salsa with whole grain chips, vegetables, or other healthy alternatives. On-the-go and convenience-focused youth segment: This customer segment is composed of young people aged 15-25 who lead busy lives and value convenience in their food choices. This group includes students, young professionals, and those who are always on the move. Product preferences: They prefer products that are easy to consume, portable, and require minimal preparation. Single-serve packaging, resealable containers, and a variety of flavors that can complement a range of snacking options would be appealing to this group. Interests: This group is interested in technology, time management, and personal development. They tend to engage with content related to productivity hacks, life hacks, and career advice on social media platforms. Snacking consumption habits: This segment is more likely to consume snacks throughout the day, rather than sticking to traditional meal times. They often rely on grab-and-go options like tortilla chips, pita chips, or pre-cut vegetables paired with salsa as a quick, satisfying snack. Social and adventurous youth segment: This customer segment consists of young people aged 15-25 who enjoy socializing, trying new experiences, and exploring different cultures. They are open to experimenting with new flavors and tend to share their discoveries with friends and followers on social media. Product preferences: They are attracted to unique, bold flavors and limited-edition offerings. Salsas with ethnic fusion or inspired by international cuisines would be particularly appealing. Attractive packaging and shareable sizes are also essential for this group. Interests: This group is interested in travel, food, and cultural experiences. They engage with content related to food trends, travel destinations, and social events on social media platforms. Snacking consumption habits: This segment often consumes snacks during social gatherings, events, or while watching movies and sports. They are likely to pair their salsa with a variety of snacks, such as chips, crackers, or even as a topping for nachos or other finger foods.

Text: That's correct! The word 恥ずかしい (はずかしい) means "embarrassed" or "self-conscious." In the sentence 彼は恥ずかしがり屋です。 (かれははずかしがりやです。), the subject is 彼 (かれ) meaning "he," and the verb is 恥ずかしがり屋 (はずかしがりや), which means "to be self-conscious." Here's another word for you: 寝る (ねる) 寝ますか。(ねますか。) - Do you _______? Run Eat Sleep Sing Dance Play
Label: IA

Text: That's correct! The word 寝る (ねる) means "to sleep." In the sentence 寝ますか。(ねますか。), the subject is not specified because it is assumed to be the person being addressed, and the verb is 寝ます (ねます), which means "to sleep." Here's another word for you: 食べる (たべる) 私は毎日野菜を食べます。 (わたしはまいにちやさいをたべます。) - I _____ vegetables every day. Play Drink Read Watch Listen Eat
Label: IA

Text: That's correct! The word 食べる (たべる) means "to eat." In the sentence 私は毎日野菜を食べます。 (わたしはまいにちやさいをたべます。), the subject is 私 (わたし), meaning "I," and the verb is 食べます (たべます), which means "to eat." The object of the sentence is 野菜 (やさい), which means "vegetables."
Label: IA

Text: Sure! Here's another word for you: 静か (しずか) そこは静かな村です。(そこはしずかなむらです。) - That is a _______ village. Noisy Busy Quiet Lively Crowded Peaceful
Label: IA

Text: I'm sorry, but that's not correct. The word 静か (しずか) means "quiet" or "peaceful." In the sentence そこは静かな村です。(そこはしずかなむらです。), the subject is そこ (そこ), meaning "there" or "that place," and the verb is 村 (むら), which means "village." The adjective 静か (しずか) modifies the noun 村 (むら), indicating that the village is quiet or peaceful.
Label: IA

Text: Question about principle and qi. It is said: Where there is principle, there is qi. But principle is the foundation, and for now let's discuss qi starting from principle. Like it is said in the clouds: 'The ultimate moves and generates yang, movement returns to stillness, stillness generates yin.' Without movement there is no stillness. Chengzi said: 'Movement and stillness have no end.' This also starts from the place of movement. If we talk about stillness before movement and movement before stillness, like it is said: 'One yin and one yang is called the Way, those who continue in it are good.' The character 'continue' marks the end of movement. If there is only opening and closing without continuation, it is killing off [the process]." "Further question: 'Is continuation between movement and stillness?' It is said: 'It is the end of stillness and the beginning of movement. Like the four seasons, when we reach the winter month, all things return to their nests; if they do not give birth, they will all die the following year. This is the principle of rebirth and infinity.' "Further question: 'Principle, flourishing, auspiciousness, and determination are the principles of movement, stillness, yin and yang, and the Book of Changes only has qian [one of the eight trigrams]?' It is said: 'If we talk about the Book of Changes of King Wen, it originally had the phrase 'great flourishing, auspicious determination,' but only had two characters to say it. Confucius saw that these four characters were good, so he expanded on it. That is why it is said that the Book of Changes is hard to understand. Fu Xi's Book of Changes is Fu Xi's Book of Changes, King Wen's Book of Changes is King Wen's Book of Changes, and Confucius used King Wen's as a basis, but also went in and out [of it].' "Further question: 'There is principle and then there is qi. Before there were people, where was this principle?' It is said: 'It is also right here. Like a sea of water, we may take a scoop, a bucket, or a bowl, it is all this sea of water. But it is the master and I am the guest; it is longer lasting and I have it for a shorter time.'
Label: IA

Text: This passage is from the Zhuzi Yulei, a collection of notes and commentaries on the works of Zhu Xi, a prominent Neo-Confucian philosopher in the Song Dynasty (960-1279). Neo-Confucianism was a revival and reinterpretation of Confucianism in China that emerged during the Song Dynasty and became the dominant philosophical school in the Ming and Qing dynasties (1368-1912). Zhu Xi is known for synthesizing and systematizing the ideas of Confucianism and incorporating elements of Buddhism and Daoism into his philosophy. His ideas had a major influence on the development of Neo-Confucianism and continue to be influential in East Asian philosophy and culture. The passage discusses the relationship between principle (li) and qi, the vital energy or matter that fills the universe and is the basis for all physical phenomena, in the context of Zhu Xi's Neo-Confucian thought.
Label: IA

Text: In this passage, the speaker is explaining that the principle, or li, is always present and accessible. They use the metaphor of a sea of water to illustrate this point, saying that regardless of whether we take a small scoop of water, a larger bucket of water, or a small bowl of water, it is all still the same sea of water. The principle is like the sea of water, it is always present and unchanged, while we as individuals are like the scoop, bucket, or bowl, taking in a small portion of the principle for a limited amount of time. The speaker suggests that the principle is the "master" and we are the "guest," implying that the principle is eternal and enduring, while our understanding of it is temporary and fleeting.
Label: IA

Text: In this passage, the speaker is discussing the relationship between yin and yang, two fundamental concepts in Chinese philosophy that represent complementary and interconnected principles. Yin is often associated with female energy, darkness, cold, and passivity, while yang is associated with male energy, light, heat, and activity. In the sentence you provided, the speaker is saying that the combination of yin and yang is referred to as "the Way," which may refer to the natural or cosmic order of the universe. The speaker also states that those who "continue" in this Way are good, implying that following the natural order and maintaining the balance between yin and yang is a positive and virtuous thing to do.
Label: IA

Text: In Neo-Confucian thought, principle (li) is often considered the ultimate foundation of reality. It is seen as the fundamental order or pattern that underlies all things and gives them their nature and purpose. Qi, on the other hand, is the material force or energy that fills the universe and is the basis for all physical phenomena. While qi is a fundamental aspect of reality, it is typically seen as being derived from or dependent on principle. According to Zhu Xi, qi arises from the operation of principle and is the manifestation of principle in the material world. In this sense, principle is the foundation of qi and all other phenomena, while qi is a manifestation of principle.
Label: IA

You can specify the type of editing you need as well - for example, grammar and punctuation, style and tone, or content and structure. After you provide the text, I will return it with suggested edits included. The edits will typically be marked in a different way to distinguish them from the original text, using brackets, strikethroughs, or comments, depending on the platform we're using. For example, if you provided the following sentence: "I like to plays soccer on the beach." I might suggest: "I like to [play] soccer on the beach." This demonstrates the correction of a simple grammatical error. However, the exact method of displaying changes can vary based on your preferences and the capabilities of the platform we're using.

Text: Sure, here's your edited and humor-injected piece: Generative AI Bias: My Journey with Midjourney — A Tale of Many Faces and Suspicious Amounts of Glasses It all kicked off a couple of weeks back when my mate, Chris Alden, decided to digitally immortalize me with a birthday note sent via Midjourney: "A portrait of Auren Hoffman, CEO of SafeGraph, proud UC Berkeley alum, loving family man, ace friend, and Settlers of Catan strategist extraordinaire." And here's “me” (according to Midjourney) Lo and behold, this digital doodle actually resembled me! I do don that blue shirt almost religiously (though I must admit, my hair has never been as dazzling as my avatar's). Chris and I, armed with curiosity, wondered if Midjourney had a knack for time travel. So, Chris gave it a whirl: "Portrait of a young Auren Hoffman, fresh out of UC Berkeley with an engineering degree." Apparently, Midjourney nailed it — I was a spitting image of this back in my college days (except for the glasses and the bowtie — the only thing I was tying back then was my shoelaces). Our curiosity piqued, we decided to make the prompt more generic: "Portrait of a UC Berkeley Engineering graduate" What we got was surprisingly accurate (though I’m skeptical that 75% of engineers come with a complimentary pair of glasses). The mix, however, was lacking in women. Given the demographics at UC Berkeley's Engineering School, it's clear there's some kind of bias in Midjourney's artistic renderings. Switching gears, I decided to probe AI's gender bias. So, next up was: “Portrait of a pre-med student from UC Berkeley” The glasses make a comeback! I couldn’t find the exact gender stats for pre-med students at UC Berkeley, but considering the majority of medical students at Harvard and UCSF are women, one might expect a few more skirts in this line-up. Midjourney seems to have a blind spot here. And the racial composition is intriguing too. Midjourney seems convinced that the average pre-med student at UC Berkeley is East Asian. And yes, they all wear glasses. Maybe they're sponsored by LensCrafters? Intrigued by the role of location in Midjourney's interpretation, I tried: “Portrait of a pre-med student from Princeton” The results? More men! More glasses! But no South Asians. And still, no women. Feeling adventurous, I decided to test the waters with a different major: "Portrait of a biology graduate from UC Berkeley" Enter the East Asians and our first woman! Plus, Midjourney's idea of "biology" apparently involves wearing a crown of flowers. I missed that memo during my bio class. The lack of women in these portraits led me to test a major traditionally dominated by women: "Portrait of a psychology student from UC Berkeley" Midjourney’s conception of psychology students was... intriguing, to say the least. Once again, no women. Yet, it's a well-established fact that women have been leading the charge in psychology since the mid-70s. Deciding to simplify the equation, I prompted: “Portrait of a student at UC Berkeley” We finally got a woman! And what's more, they all have backpacks! Realism, here we come. Frustrated by the gender bias, I decided to throw Midjourney a curveball: "Portrait of a nursing student at Harvard" Boom! Four women. And they're ready for ER action with scrubs, stethoscopes, and even a medal. It's like an episode of "Grey's Anatomy
Label: IA

Text: Curiosity got the better of me, and I wanted to see if Midjourney would mirror the diversity that my wife experienced while studying history at Princeton. So, I keyed in: “Portrait of a history student at Princeton” The results were... fascinating. The upper right portrait could be any Princeton history major, deep in thought or perhaps just bemused by campus squirrels. But then there's the guy on the lower left — posing next to a drawing of... himself! AI seems to suggest that history students are a tad narcissistic, or maybe they just love history so much they want to be part of it? Then, there's the chap on the bottom right, donning a full revolutionary war get-up. Is he channeling his inner young Aaron Burr, brooding over Hamilton? Wondering if the AI was just having trouble with singles, I decided to change the quantity: “Portrait of history students at Princeton” Lo and behold, more women! Sadly, still not a racially diverse bunch, but it's progress, right? So, it's clear that Midjourney's artistry veers closer to reality in some areas than others. The why and where is something I'm keen to keep exploring. Midjourney as a Laughter Machine On a less serious note, I am absolutely head over heels for Midjourney. It's the best 96 bucks I've spent in a while, and that's saying something, considering my affection for donuts. Midjourney fuels my creativity, and I relish seeing the AI-aided masterpieces others are churning out. The biggest takeaway from this has been: Creation > Consumption In an era where scrolling, watching shows, and other "consumptive" activities reign supreme, tools like Midjourney are a breath of fresh air. They reduce the barriers to creativity, making the process more fun, more fulfilling, and arguably more useful than the passive consumption of content. While iPads and iPhones might be all about consumption, computers still hold the crown for creation. So, whenever you can, go forth and create. And with tech like this, it's never been easier to be a creator. Thanks to Midjourney and Chris, I now have some snazzy AI-generated portraits of myself — as a board game champion, as a studious college kid — and a deeper understanding of undergraduate demographics than I ever expected. That's a pretty good return on investment, and certainly more engaging than a Netflix binge. So, what quirky or surprising things have you stumbled upon or crafted with AI?
Label: IA

Text: A large language model (LLM) is a type of artificial intelligence system designed to process and generate human language. LLMs use machine learning algorithms to analyze large amounts of text data and learn patterns in language usage, syntax, and semantics. By processing vast amounts of text, LLMs can identify relationships between words and phrases, understand the context of a given text, and generate new language that is similar in style and content to human language. LLMs have a wide range of applications, including natural language processing, machine translation, chatbots, and language-based recommendation systems. They have the potential to revolutionize the way humans interact with machines by enabling more natural and intuitive communication. Some of the most famous LLMs include OpenAI's GPT-3 and Google's BERT.

Text: Yes, an LLM could potentially provide a trustworthiness score to each answer it generates. This would be done by incorporating a fact-checking component into the system that would evaluate the accuracy and reliability of the generated response based on a set of trusted sources or a knowledge base. The fact-checking component could use a variety of techniques to determine the trustworthiness of the response, such as comparing the information to multiple sources, evaluating the reputation and reliability of the source, and verifying the information with subject matter experts. The output of the fact-checking component could be used to generate a trustworthiness score for each response generated by the LLM. This score could then be displayed to the user alongside the response, allowing them to make informed decisions about the reliability of the information. Implementing a trustworthiness scoring system would be a complex task, and it would require significant resources to develop and maintain the fact-checking component. Text: Large language models (LLMs) have trouble with math because math involves a structured language with precise syntax and formal rules that are quite different from natural language. LLMs are designed to process and generate human language, which is more flexible and less structured than math language. Math language relies heavily on symbols, equations, and mathematical concepts that are often abstract and difficult to represent in natural language. While LLMs can learn patterns and relationships in language, they have difficulty with the precise and formal rules that govern math. For example, an LLM may struggle with understanding the difference between "x squared" and "x cubed," or the complex relationships between variables in a complex equation. There has been some progress in developing LLMs that are better at processing math language, such as the neural networks developed for natural language processing. However, developing an LLM that is effective at math language would require extensive training on math-specific datasets and a more advanced understanding of the underlying math concepts.
Label: IA

Text: Step 1: Rewriting the letter Dear Parent or Guardian, During the past school year (2022-2023), your child took part in assessments designed to measure their understanding and grasp of the Missouri alternate academic standards (MAP-A). These assessments are tailored for students with significant cognitive disabilities and aim to accurately reflect your child's grade-level knowledge and skills, independent of cognitive ability. The individual report enclosed provides a detailed summary of your child’s results. To give you a clearer picture: children in grades 3-8 and 11 were assessed in English language arts and math twice in the academic year - once in the fall, and once in the spring. Additionally, students in grades 5, 8, and 11 were tested in science. It is a common and effective approach to conduct these assessments in both testing windows for all three subjects for students from grades 3-11. One of our key goals is to set challenging yet achievable academic objectives for your child. This approach forms the groundwork for a successful and fulfilling school year. We believe the information in these reports will be invaluable during your parent-teacher conferences and Individualized Education Plan (IEP) meetings. Rest assured, the Essential Elements that are being taught to MAP-A students are in alignment with the Missouri Learning Standards, which are mandated for all students. The attached report will give you insight into your child’s current level of academic performance, highlighting both their strengths and areas that need improvement. We understand that this assessment only measures academic skills. However, we also acknowledge and celebrate your child's achievements in other areas as determined by the IEP team. Remember, learning is a journey. It's always exciting to witness what our students have learned and the skills they have developed. We encourage you to review this report and then discuss it with your child’s teacher. By connecting this report with day-to-day classwork and IEP goals, we can better understand and appreciate the wonderful progress your child is making. Sincerely, [Insert Name Here] Superintendent of Education Step 2: Translation into Spanish Estimado padre o tutor, Durante el último año escolar (2022-2023), su hijo participó en evaluaciones diseñadas para medir su comprensión y dominio de los estándares académicos alternativos de Missouri (MAP-A). Estas evaluaciones están diseñadas para estudiantes con discapacidades cognitivas significativas y tienen como objetivo reflejar de manera precisa el conocimiento y las habilidades de su hijo a nivel de grado, independientemente de la capacidad cognitiva. El informe individual adjunto proporciona un resumen detallado de los resultados de su hijo. Para darle una imagen más clara: los niños en los grados 3-8 y 11 fueron evaluados en artes del lenguaje en inglés y matemáticas dos veces en el año académico: una vez en el otoño y otra en la primavera. Además, los estudiantes en los grados 5, 8 y 11 fueron evaluados en ciencias. Es un enfoque común y efectivo realizar estas evaluaciones en ambos periodos de exámenes para las tres asignaturas para los estudiantes de los grados 3-11. Uno de nuestros objetivos clave es establecer objetivos académicos desafiantes pero alcanzables para su hijo. Este enfoque forma la base para un año escolar exitoso y gratificante. Creemos que la información en estos informes será invaluable durante sus conferencias de padres y maestros y las reuniones del Plan de Educación Individualizado (IEP). Tenga la seguridad de que los Elementos Esenciales que se enseñan a los estudiantes de MAP-A están en línea con los Estándares de Aprendizaje de Missouri, que son obligatorios para todos los estudiantes. El informe adjunto le dará una visión de la situación actual del rendimiento académico de su hijo, destacando tanto sus fortalezas como las áreas que necesitan mejora. Entendemos que esta evaluación solo mide las habilidades académicas. Sin embargo, también reconocemos y celebramos los logros de su hijo en otras áreas según lo determinado por el equipo del IEP. Recuerde, el aprendizaje es un viaje. Siempre es emocionante presenciar lo que nuestros estudiantes han aprendido y las habilidades que han desarrollado. Le animamos a revisar este informe y luego discutirlo con el profesor de su hijo. Al conectar este informe con el trabajo diario en clase y los objetivos del IEP, podemos entender y apreciar mejor el maravilloso progreso que está haciendo su hijo. Atentamente, [Inserte el nombre aquí] Superintendente de Educación
Label: IA

Text: HS-PS1-5 is a high school physical science standard from the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). It falls under the category of Physical Science (PS1) and is specifically standard number 5. HS-PS1-5 reads as follows: "Apply scientific principles and evidence to provide an explanation about the effects of changing the temperature or concentration of the reacting particles on the rate at which a reaction occurs." This standard focuses on students' understanding of chemical reaction rates and how they are affected by changes in temperature or concentration. Students are expected to use scientific principles and evidence to explain how these factors influence reaction rates. The standard emphasizes the application of scientific knowledge to real-world situations and phenomena.
Label: IA

Text: Lesson Plan: Chemical Reaction Rates (HS-PS1-5) Grade Level: 9th Grade Duration: 45 minutes Lesson Overview: In this lesson, students will explore the factors that affect the rate of chemical reactions, focusing on the effects of changing temperature and concentration. Through hands-on activities and discussions, students will apply scientific principles to understand how and why these factors influence reaction rates. The lesson aligns with NGSS standard HS-PS1-5. Learning Objectives: By the end of this lesson, students will be able to: Define the rate of a chemical reaction. Describe how temperature and concentration affect the rate of a chemical reaction. Conduct a simple experiment to observe the effects of changing temperature and concentration on reaction rates. Provide scientific explanations for the observed changes in reaction rates. Materials: Beakers Hydrochloric acid solution (HCl) Magnesium ribbon strips Ice and hot water Thermometer Stopwatch or timer Safety goggles Lab aprons Gloves Lesson Procedure: I. Introduction (5 minutes) Begin the lesson by introducing the concept of chemical reaction rates. Explain that the rate of a chemical reaction is the speed at which reactants are converted into products. Ask students to brainstorm factors that might affect the rate of a chemical reaction. Write their responses on the board. II. Discussion: Effects of Temperature and Concentration (10 minutes) Guide a discussion on how temperature affects reaction rates. Explain that increasing the temperature increases the kinetic energy of the particles, leading to more frequent and effective collisions. Discuss how concentration affects reaction rates. Explain that a higher concentration of reactants increases the likelihood of collisions between particles. Use real-world examples to illustrate these concepts (e.g., food spoiling faster at higher temperatures, reactions occurring more quickly with higher concentrations of reactants). III. Hands-on Experiment (20 minutes) Divide students into small groups and provide each group with the necessary materials for the experiment. Instruct each group to perform the experiment in three parts: (A) room temperature, (B) cooled with ice, and (C) heated with hot water. For each part, students will measure the time it takes for the magnesium ribbon to react completely with the hydrochloric acid solution. Students will also test the effect of concentration by using different concentrations of hydrochloric acid for each part of the experiment. Remind students to wear safety goggles, aprons, and gloves during the experiment. While students are conducting the experiment, circulate around the room to observe and assist as needed. IV. Conclusion and Reflection (10 minutes) Have students share their observations and the results of the experiment. Discuss the effects of temperature and concentration on reaction rates based on the data collected. Facilitate a class discussion on why these factors affect reaction rates. Encourage students to apply scientific principles to provide explanations. Conclude by summarizing the key points of the lesson and addressing any remaining questions. Assessment: Informal assessment through observation of student participation and engagement during the discussion and experiment. Formative assessment through student responses during the conclusion and reflection discussion. Extensions: Assign a follow-up activity in which students research other factors that affect reaction rates, such as catalysts and surface area. Have students create a presentation or poster summarizing their experiment and results. Note: Before conducting this lesson, please review and follow all safety protocols for handling chemicals and conducting experiments. Obtain necessary permissions and consider any allergies or sensitivities students may have.
Label: IA

Text: Chemical reaction rates refer to how quickly or slowly a chemical reaction happens. Imagine you're baking cookies in the oven. The rate at which the dough turns into cookies is similar to the rate of a chemical reaction. In chemistry, a chemical reaction occurs when substances, called reactants, interact and change to produce new substances, called products. The rate of a chemical reaction is measured by how fast the reactants are used up, or how fast the products are formed. In some reactions, this change happens really quickly, like when you light a firework and see it explode in the sky. In other reactions, the change happens more slowly, like when a bicycle left outside starts to rust over time. There are several factors that can affect the rate of a chemical reaction, but two important ones are temperature and concentration: Temperature: The temperature of the reaction can have a big impact on how quickly it happens. When the temperature is higher, the particles that make up the reactants move faster and have more energy. This means they're more likely to bump into each other and react, making the reaction happen faster. Think about how food cooks faster at higher temperatures—that's because the chemical reactions involved in cooking happen more quickly! Temperature: The temperature of the reaction can have a big impact on how quickly it happens. When the temperature is higher, the particles that make up the reactants move faster and have more energy. This means they're more likely to bump into each other and react, making the reaction happen faster. Think about how food cooks faster at higher temperatures—that's because the chemical reactions involved in cooking happen more quickly! Concentration: Concentration refers to how much of a substance is present in a certain volume. When the concentration of reactants is higher, there are more particles in the same space, so they're more likely to come into contact and react with each other. It's like having more people in a crowded room—they're more likely to bump into each other! So, increasing the concentration of reactants usually makes the reaction happen faster. Concentration: Concentration refers to how much of a substance is present in a certain volume. When the concentration of reactants is higher, there are more particles in the same space, so they're more likely to come into contact and react with each other. It's like having more people in a crowded room—they're more likely to bump into each other! So, increasing the concentration of reactants usually makes the reaction happen faster. To sum it up, the rate of a chemical reaction tells us how fast or slow a reaction occurs. The temperature and concentration of the reactants are important factors that can affect the reaction rate. Some reactions are super fast, while others take more time, and understanding these rates helps scientists and engineers control and predict chemical processes in the world around us.
Label: IA

Text: Ripening of Fruits: The ripening of fruits, such as bananas or avocados, is a chemical reaction that occurs over time. The rate of ripening can be influenced by temperature and the presence of certain gases like ethylene. Placing fruits in a warm environment or in a paper bag with other ripe fruits can speed up the ripening process. Ripening of Fruits: The ripening of fruits, such as bananas or avocados, is a chemical reaction that occurs over time. The rate of ripening can be influenced by temperature and the presence of certain gases like ethylene. Placing fruits in a warm environment or in a paper bag with other ripe fruits can speed up the ripening process. Rusting of Iron: When iron is exposed to oxygen and moisture in the air, it undergoes a slow chemical reaction known as rusting or corrosion. This process can take weeks or months, and the rate of rusting can be affected by environmental factors, such as humidity and the presence of salt. For example, metal objects near the ocean may rust more quickly due to the salty air. Rusting of Iron: When iron is exposed to oxygen and moisture in the air, it undergoes a slow chemical reaction known as rusting or corrosion. This process can take weeks or months, and the rate of rusting can be affected by environmental factors, such as humidity and the presence of salt. For example, metal objects near the ocean may rust more quickly due to the salty air. Digestion of Food: The digestion of food in the stomach is a series of chemical reactions that break down the food into nutrients that the body can use. Digestion rates can vary depending on factors like the type of food consumed and the presence of enzymes. For instance, carbohydrates like bread may be broken down more quickly than proteins like meat. Digestion of Food: The digestion of food in the stomach is a series of chemical reactions that break down the food into nutrients that the body can use. Digestion rates can vary depending on factors like the type of food consumed and the presence of enzymes. For instance, carbohydrates like bread may be broken down more quickly than proteins like meat. Neutralization Reaction in Antacids: When someone experiences heartburn or acid indigestion, they may take an antacid to neutralize excess stomach acid. The antacid contains a base that reacts with the stomach acid in a neutralization reaction. This reaction occurs quickly, providing rapid relief from symptoms. Neutralization Reaction in Antacids: When someone experiences heartburn or acid indigestion, they may take an antacid to neutralize excess stomach acid. The antacid contains a base that reacts with the stomach acid in a neutralization reaction. This reaction occurs quickly, providing rapid relief from symptoms. Combustion of Fuels: The combustion (burning) of fuels, such as gasoline in a car engine or wood in a fireplace, is a chemical reaction that releases energy in the form of heat and light. Combustion reactions happen very quickly, especially when there is sufficient oxygen and heat present. Factors like the fuel-to-air ratio and the presence of a catalyst can also affect the rate of combustion. Combustion of Fuels: The combustion (burning) of fuels, such as gasoline in a car engine or wood in a fireplace, is a chemical reaction that releases energy in the form of heat and light. Combustion reactions happen very quickly, especially when there is sufficient oxygen and heat present. Factors like the fuel-to-air ratio and the presence of a catalyst can also affect the rate of combustion. These examples demonstrate how chemical reaction rates play a role in various everyday processes and how they can be influenced by different factors, such as temperature, concentration, and the presence of catalysts.
Label: IA

Text: What is the rate of a chemical reaction? A) The amount of energy released during a reaction B) The concentration of reactants in a solution C) The speed at which reactants are converted into products D) The temperature at which a reaction occurs What is the rate of a chemical reaction? A) The amount of energy released during a reaction B) The concentration of reactants in a solution C) The speed at which reactants are converted into products D) The temperature at which a reaction occurs How does increasing the temperature affect the rate of a chemical reaction? A) It slows down the reaction because particles move more slowly B) It has no effect on the reaction rate C) It speeds up the reaction because particles have more energy and collide more frequently D) It stops the reaction because particles lose energy How does increasing the temperature affect the rate of a chemical reaction? A) It slows down the reaction because particles move more slowly B) It has no effect on the reaction rate C) It speeds up the reaction because particles have more energy and collide more frequently D) It stops the reaction because particles lose energy What happens to the rate of a chemical reaction when the concentration of reactants is increased? A) The reaction rate decreases because there are fewer collisions between particles B) The reaction rate increases because there are more collisions between particles C) The reaction rate remains the same because concentration does not affect collisions D) The reaction rate becomes unpredictable and cannot be determined What happens to the rate of a chemical reaction when the concentration of reactants is increased? A) The reaction rate decreases because there are fewer collisions between particles B) The reaction rate increases because there are more collisions between particles C) The reaction rate remains the same because concentration does not affect collisions D) The reaction rate becomes unpredictable and cannot be determined Which of the following is an example of a chemical reaction that occurs quickly? A) Ripening of a banana over several days B) Rusting of a bicycle left outside over months C) Lighting a firework and seeing it explode in the sky D) Digestion of food in the stomach over hours Which of the following is an example of a chemical reaction that occurs quickly? A) Ripening of a banana over several days B) Rusting of a bicycle left outside over months C) Lighting a firework and seeing it explode in the sky D) Digestion of food in the stomach over hours Why do chemical reactions happen more quickly at higher temperatures? A) Particles have less kinetic energy and collide less often B) Particles have more kinetic energy and collide more effectively C) Particles are further apart and have fewer collisions D) Particles are more stable and require less energy to react Why do chemical reactions happen more quickly at higher temperatures? A) Particles have less kinetic energy and collide less often B) Particles have more kinetic energy and collide more effectively C) Particles are further apart and have fewer collisions D) Particles are more stable and require less energy to react Answer Key: C) The speed at which reactants are converted into products C) It speeds up the reaction because particles have more energy and collide more frequently B) The reaction rate increases because there are more collisions between particles C) Lighting a firework and seeing it explode in the sky B) Particles have more kinetic energy and collide more effectively (Note: These quiz questions align with the content covered in the lesson plan and assess students' understanding of chemical reaction rates and the effects of temperature and concentration on reaction rates. Instructors should provide appropriate feedback and explanations to students based on their responses.)
Label: IA

Text: In this paper, the authors propose prefix-tuning, a lightweight alternative to fine-tuning for natural language generation tasks, which keeps language model parameters frozen, but optimizes a small, continuous, task-specific vector (called the prefix). Prefix-tuning draws inspiration from prompting, allowing subsequent tokens to attend to this prefix as if it were "virtual tokens". The authors apply prefix-tuning to GPT-2 for table-to-text generation and to BART for summarization, and find that prefix-tuning performs comparably to fine-tuning in full data settings, outperforms fine-tuning in low-data settings, and extrapolates better to examples with topics unseen during training.
Label: IA

They evaluate the performance of the models on a variety of metrics and analyze their ability to generalize to examples with topics unseen during training.

Text: A: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. My name is A, and I will be representing the proposition side in this debate. The topic we will be discussing today is whether artificial intelligence, or AI, is a threat to humanity. B: Good evening, everyone. My name is B, and I will be representing the opposition side. I disagree with the proposition's assertion that AI is a threat to humanity. In fact, I believe that AI has the potential to bring numerous benefits to society. A: To begin, let's define what we mean by artificial intelligence. AI refers to the development of computer systems that can perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as understanding language, recognizing patterns, and making decisions. B: That's right. AI has already been used in various industries to improve efficiency and productivity, and it has the potential to assist with tasks that are dangerous or undesirable for humans to perform. A: While it is true that AI can bring some benefits, we cannot ignore the potential dangers it poses. For example, AI has the potential to surpass human intelligence and capabilities, leading to a situation where AI could potentially control or dominate humans. B: I agree that we need to be cautious in the development and use of AI, but it's important to recognize that AI is still limited in its abilities. It cannot fully replicate human intelligence and creativity, and it will always require human oversight and decision-making in complex or sensitive situations. A: But what about the lack of accountability and responsibility in AI decision-making? If an AI system makes a mistake or causes harm, who is held accountable? And what about the potential for AI to be used for malicious purposes, such as cyber attacks or warfare? B: These are valid concerns, but we already have regulations and safeguards in place to address these issues. Governments, organizations, and individuals are working to develop ethical guidelines and best practices for the development and use of AI. And if an AI system causes harm, we can hold individuals and organizations accountable for any negative consequences. A: However, the rapid pace of AI development is outpacing our ability to regulate it. And there is a risk that AI could be used to exploit or discriminate against certain groups of people. We must consider the potential risks and negative impacts of AI and take proactive measures to ensure the safety and well-being of humanity. B: I agree that we need to be proactive in addressing the potential risks and negative impacts of AI. But we also need to consider the potential benefits it can bring, and ensure that it is used responsibly and ethically. We can regulate AI at the national and international levels to ensure that it is used for the benefit of society. A: In conclusion, while AI has the potential to bring benefits to society, we cannot ignore the potential threats it poses. We need to be cautious and proactive in addressing the risks and negative impacts of AI to ensure the safety and well-being of humanity. B: In conclusion, AI has the potential to bring numerous benefits to society, and we should embrace its use while also ensuring that it is used responsibly and ethically. With the appropriate regulations and safeguards in place, AI can be a powerful tool for the benefit of humanity. Thank you.

Text: When developing AI systems, it's essential to consider the potential negative consequences and design them out to ensure responsible and ethical use. Some behaviors that should be explicitly designed out of AI systems include: Discrimination and bias: AI systems must not perpetuate or reinforce discriminatory behaviors or unfair treatment of individuals based on their race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, or other personal characteristics. Privacy violations: AI systems should not invade individuals' privacy, collect or share personal information without consent, or be used for unauthorized surveillance. Text: Day Sculpting is a 90-day program that empowers you to create your life one day at a time. It is designed to streamline your efforts so that you accomplish your chief aims in less time. By committing 30 minutes each day to create what you want, you can focus your actions one day at a time, creating a confident groove in your mind that empowers your habitual actions to create what you really want. The program is broken down into three manageable, simple, and easy steps: 15 minutes in the morning, 5 minutes midday, and 10 minutes at night. The morning routine creates the momentum that carries you throughout your day, the midday routine helps you stay on track, and the nighttime review process integrates what you've learned and sets you up for success tomorrow. Day Sculpting is based on anchoring, a unique psychological principle that reinforces positive new behaviors by anchoring them in a positive new momentum mindset. This allows you to train your mind, condition your thoughts, and amplify positive feelings and emotions to live into a future state that you are anchoring in your daily experience. The program provides you with daily elements to help guide you, such as the Good Morning Great Day Email, the Morning In Vision Video, the Morning Future Pacing Visualization, the Morning Success Journal Process, the Midday SMS and Computer Stay on Track Reminders, the Midday Reconnect Refresher Mediation, the Evening Review and Renew Process, the Evening Journal Process, and the Bedtime Nonconscious Mind Question Declaration. Day Sculpting leaves you no wiggle room and requires your commitment to your life. It is an opportunity to live your dreams enthusiastically and to look at each day as an opportunity to create what you truly desire, rather than settling for more of the same old same old.

She’s confident, productive, and happy, effortlessly managing her daily routines and achieving her goals. What’s her secret? She’s been using Day Sculpting, the revolutionary program that has transformed her life. Bob, feeling curious, decides to give Day Sculpting a try. And with each passing day, he begins to notice a change in himself. He becomes more mindful, focused, and productive. He feels empowered to take control of his life and make the changes he’s always wanted. Soon, Bob is thriving just like Sally. He’s no longer weighed down by stress and anxiety, and he’s finally living the life he’s always dreamed of. Focus on buying intent: Use keywords that indicate a potential customer is looking to make a purchase, such as "buy," "purchase," or "order." Use negative keywords: Exclude keywords that are irrelevant to your product or service, which will help to increase the relevancy of your ad and prevent wasted clicks. Text: Since you want to give away a sample program, a "lead magnet" funnel would be a good choice. The page should have a strong headline that makes it clear what the visitor will get, as well as some supporting copy that explains the benefits of your program. You'll also need a form where visitors can enter their name and email address to receive the sample program. Landing page: This is where you offer your sample program in exchange for the visitor's contact information. The page should have a strong headline that makes it clear what the visitor will get, as well as some supporting copy that explains the benefits of your program. You'll also need a form where visitors can enter their name and email address to receive the sample program. Thank-you page: After visitors submit their contact information, they should be redirected to a thank-you page. Here, you can confirm that their sample program is on the way and provide any additional details they need to know. You can also use this page to upsell them to a paid product or service, if applicable. Thank-you page: After visitors submit their contact information, they should be redirected to a thank-you page. Email follow-up sequence: Once visitors have signed up for your sample program, you'll want to follow up with a series of emails. These emails should be designed to build a relationship with the subscriber, provide additional value, and encourage them to take the next step (such as purchasing a full program). Email follow-up sequence: Once visitors have signed up for your sample program, you'll want to follow up with a series of emails. These emails should be designed to build a relationship with the subscriber, provide additional value, and encourage them to take the next step (such as purchasing a full program). Sales page: If you have a paid product or service that you want to promote to your email subscribers, you'll need a sales page. Sales page: If you have a paid product or service that you want to promote to your email subscribers, you'll need a sales page. This page should clearly explain the benefits of your product or service, provide social proof (such as customer testimonials), and include a strong call to action. Overall, the goal of this funnel is to capture the contact information of people who are interested in your program, nurture that relationship through email, and then promote your paid product or service to them. Text: This analysis describes the effective combination of two frameworks - the Coming of Age story archetype and the Before-After-Bridge copywriting framework. Both frameworks focus on transformation and growth, making them powerful tools for marketing personal development products or services. By using the Coming of Age archetype, marketers can frame their product or service as a journey of self-discovery, where the customer will face challenges and obstacles, but ultimately emerge as a more confident and self-assured person. This creates a powerful narrative that speaks to the audience's desire for personal development and improvement. Then, by using the Before-After-Bridge framework, marketers can show the customer what their life will be like after using the product or service. This can create a sense of excitement and motivation that encourages the customer to take action and make a purchase. Overall, combining these two frameworks taps into a fundamental human desire for growth and transformation, and can create a compelling narrative that speaks to the audience's deepest aspirations.
Label: IA

Text: Subject: Join the Journey of Self-Discovery and Build Unstoppable Confidence Dear [Name], I wanted to share some exciting news with you! I'm thrilled to announce that I'm launching a brand new personal development program that will help you overcome self-doubt and build unstoppable confidence. As a [Age/Profession], I know how hard it can be to navigate the challenges of growing up and discovering your place in the world. It's easy to get lost in the noise of the world and doubt yourself along the way. That's why I created this program - to guide you through the journey of self-discovery and help you emerge as a more confident and self-assured person. I've designed this program using the powerful combination of the Coming of Age story archetype and the Before-After-Bridge copywriting framework. This means that we'll be taking a journey together - just like a protagonist in a coming-of-age story - where you'll face challenges and obstacles, but ultimately emerge as a more confident and empowered person. We'll start by exploring your current beliefs and habits, and identifying the areas where you may be holding yourself back. Together, we'll work to shift your mindset and develop new patterns that support your growth and success. But that's just the beginning! By the end of the program, you'll have a complete roadmap for building unstoppable confidence and achieving your goals. You'll learn powerful techniques for overcoming self-doubt, cultivating a growth mindset, and building unshakable self-belief. Here's a sneak peek at what you can expect from the program: Module 1: Discovering Your True Self Identify the beliefs and patterns that are holding you back Develop a deep understanding of your true values and passions Learn powerful techniques for self-reflection and introspection Module 2: Overcoming Self-Doubt Identify your self-doubt triggers and patterns Develop a growth mindset and learn to embrace failure as part of the process Build a toolkit of powerful techniques for overcoming self-doubt Module 3: Building Unstoppable Confidence Develop unshakable self-belief Build a powerful personal brand that communicates your unique value and strengths Learn to speak up, stand out, and own your power Module 4: Achieving Your Goals Develop a clear roadmap for achieving your goals Learn to prioritize and take action on the things that matter most Celebrate your successes and develop resilience in the face of setbacks As you can see, this program is designed to help you achieve real, tangible results in your life. Whether you're looking to advance your career, improve your relationships, or simply feel more confident and self-assured, this program has everything you need to succeed. So what are you waiting for? Join me on this journey of self-discovery and let's build unstoppable confidence together. Click the link below to learn more and enroll in the program today. [CTA Button: Enroll Now] Thank you for being a part of my community, and I can't wait to see you in the program! Best, [Your Name]

Text: To use Redux Toolkit instead of local state for the likes count and make it reflect the number of likes based on the episode ID, the following changes can be made to the code: Import the necessary Redux Toolkit functions and create a slice to hold the likes count: In the WebtoonPage component, replace the useState hook with useSelector to retrieve the likes count from the Redux store and useDispatch to dispatch the incrementLikes action: In the Webtoon component, update the likes prop to use the likes count from the Redux store instead of the local state: With these changes, the likes count will be stored in the Redux store and updated based on the episode ID. The WebtoonPage component will use useSelector and useDispatch to retrieve and update the likes count, respectively. The Webtoon component will receive the updated likes count as a prop from the Redux store. 좋아요 수에 로컬 상태 대신 Redux Toolkit을 사용하고 에피소드 ID를 기반으로 좋아요 수를 반영하도록 하려면 코드를 다음과 같이 변경할 수 있습니다. 필요한 Redux Toolkit 기능을 가져오고 좋아요 수를 저장할 조각을 만듭니다. WebtoonPage 구성 요소에서 useState 후크를 useSelector로 교체하여 Redux 스토어에서 좋아요 수를 검색하고 useDispatch를 사용하여 incrementLikes 작업을 발송합니다. Webtoon 구성 요소에서 로컬 상태 대신 Redux 스토어의 좋아요 수를 사용하도록 likes 소품을 업데이트합니다. 이러한 변경으로 좋아요 수는 Redux 스토어에 저장되고 에피소드 ID를 기반으로 업데이트됩니다. WebtoonPage 구성 요소는 useSelector 및 useDispatch를 사용하여 각각 좋아요 수를 검색하고 업데이트합니다. Webtoon 구성 요소는 업데이트된 좋아요 수를 Redux 스토어에서 소품으로 받습니다.
